intro: Hypericum oklahomense, commonly known as Oklahoma goldenseal, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces bright yellow flowers in the summer months. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in moist, wooded areas. It is a member of the Hippocastaneaceae family and is noted for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
